intro: Seriphidium junceum, commonly known as desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and feathery foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, rounded fruits that contain seeds. Seriphidium junceum is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
